712617f-a.text:
40th Street, Lexington, to Park Avenue. (Before Reconstruction).
President Borough of Manhattan.
March 19, 1918.

712618f-a.text:
40th Street, Lexington to Park 'venue.
President Borough of Manhattan.
March 19, 1918,
Neg. #2246

720965f-a.text:
Lexington Avenue, at the S. E. corner of East 40th Street, showing the lately erected Concord Pershing Apartment House. This was included in the Gould Estate Auction.
January 24, 1927
Joseph P. Day
Photograph Dept.
87 Liberty Street.

712615f-a.text:
International Auto School and Garage, 145-147 East 40th Street, north side, between Lexington and Third Avenues. In the background the Chrysler Building is shown under construction.
July 25,1929.
P. L. Sperr.

720977f-a.text:
Lexington Ave., east sidc, south from and including East 42nd to and including 40th Streets. Also shown is East 42nd Street, at and adjoining
the S.E. corner of Lexington Ave.
July 24, 1936.
P. L. Sperr.

720964f-a.text:
Lexington Avenue, south of E. 40th Street (foreground) as viewed from the Chanin Bldg. Note the street car tracks upon same and the bus which replaced this earlier form of transportation. To the left top appears a partial view of Third Avenue,
south from 37th Street.
October 3, 1936.
P.L. Sperr

720966f-a.text:
354-362 Lexington Ave., at, adjoining and north of the N.W. corner of East 40th Street.

April 8, 1936

P.L. Sperr.

720967f-a.text: Lexington Avenue, west side, from east 40th to 41st streets.  April 13, 1940.  F.L. Sperr.

720969f-a.text:
369 Lexington Ave., east side, between East 41st and 40th Streets. The 26-story building shown is the Lexington Towers. The view is south east from the Bowery Savings Bank Building (110-116 East 42nd Street).
March 18, 1929.
P. L. Sperr.
